title: Ticket #825: More detailed version compat check for dagman than -AllowVersionMismat
description:
-AllowVersionMismatch is necessary to override a simple strcmp check of the version strings between dagman and CSD. RH testing using all UW dag tests revealed good compatibility between mixes of 7.2.4 and 7.4.0 DM/CSD.

RH proposes a specific version check class for dagman that uses CondorVersionInfo to analyse the presented version strings in more detail. It also will be a place holder for embedding rules for known compatibility issues as they are discovered.

It essentially will allow customers in the midst of dagman migrations to "safely" run mixed environments of DM/CSD components without the need for -AllowVersionMismatch.
remarks:
2009-Oct-13 11:41:55 by tstclair:
It should be noted that existing dag jobs on CHTC upgrade (10/12/09) failed due to version mismatch.

--From Team Meeting.

2009-10-13 by wenger: Just committed a fix to this (1304b7e71b627eb6c1b7af4e920fefb82601bb38) for 7.4.0. Leaving the ticket open because I haven't documented it yet.

2009-Oct-15 10:59:38 by pmackinn:
Kent, do you think we should log the fact that the CSD was less than the DM version, even if it is within tolerance (i.e., >= 7.1.2)?

2009-10-16 by wenger: I just documented this, and I was going to resolve the ticket. Just saw the remark above by pmackinn -- I thought about that a bit, and I now I think it's a good idea (but maybe not for 7.4.0 at this point). I thought about that when I originally wrote the new check, and I didn't think it was necessary. But thinking about it again, I think it might be a good idea, mainly in case we goof up and don't update the "minimum acceptable version" when we should. That would at least give us some help in debugging the resulting problems. And most of the time, the versions should exactly match, so the warnings shouldn't happen all that often. So I'm deferring the ticket for now, and downgrading the priority.

2010-Jul-30 12:44:42 by wenger:
If the versions differ, but the difference is legal, the message could be something like this: 

  Note: condor_submit_dag version (7.5.2) differs from condor_dagman version
    (7.5.3), but the difference is allowed.

2010-Jul-30 15:03:08 by wenger:
I've now finished the code changes to print this "permissible mismatch" message, and documented that in the version history, so I'll close this ticket.
